intro: Platea malayana, commonly known as the Malayan platea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features include smooth, dark green foliage and small, rounded fruits. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in local medicine.
